channel.title: PayPal
channel.description:
Hi guys.
So... I decided to actually buy Mass Effect and use the discount. BUT. My card is total crap, unable to buy online (not VISA or MasterCard), so I want to try my luck via PayPal.
That's where my problem starts. I want to get a Personal account, yet I seem unable to find registration form for this kind for my country (Czech Republic), with only Premier and Business being options, however if I click my country to be United States (sheesh, what a lie. But hopefully in the future...), Personal account becomes an option.
Does anyone have an idea how to solve my situation? Also, while at the asking questions part, does anyone have any idea whether or not does PayPal work with Maestro cards?
Thanks in advance, Serza

item.title: PayPal
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
I pay my monthly spotify subscription with a US paypal account (I’m in Argentina). As long as you don’t go over a certain quantity of money (I think it’s 100 bucks per payment or per month, I’m not sure), you don’t have to get your card verified by paypal.

Read full topic

item.title: PayPal
item.dc:creator: Serza
item.description:
Thanks for the swift answer. I’ll have to see if the same can be done on my end. If not, it might be a good time to tell the bank they’re a bunch of two-bit backstabbing badguys and go look elsewhere.

Bad news, still a news, and I thank you once again for the information.

Read full topic

item.title: PayPal
item.dc:creator: Bolteh
item.description:
As far as I know, you can’t link Maestro cards to a PayPal account.

For a long while I simply topped up PayPal through wire transfers from my bank account to my PayPal account (i.e.: put €50 on it, when that €50 was spent, I topped the account up again).

Not sure about your first question, though. Could be that PayPal only allows business accounts in Czech Republic.

Read full topic
